verses.verse: In this way, you who are wives should submit to your own husbands. Do this so even if some men are disobedient to the word, they may be won without a word, through the behavior of their wives.
For they will have seen your sincere behavior with respect.
Let their adornment not be with the outward braiding of their hair, and wearing gold jewelry, or wearing fashionable clothing.
Instead, let it be with the inner person of the heart, and the lasting beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is precious before God.
For this is also how holy women long ago who hoped in God adorned themselves, by submitting to their husbands.
In this way Sarah obeyed Abraham and called him her lord. You are now her children if you do what is good and if you are not afraid of trouble.

In the same way, you husbands should live with your wives according to understanding, as with a weaker container, a woman. You should give them honor as also being fellow heirs of the grace of life. Do this so that your prayers will not be hindered.
But finally, all of you, be likeminded, compassionate, loving as brothers, tenderhearted, and humble.
Do not pay back evil for evil or insult for insult. On the contrary, but continue to bless, because for this you were called, that you might inherit a blessing.
For, " The one who wants to love life and see good days should stop his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking deceit.
But let him turn away from what is bad and do what is good. Let him seek peace and pursue it.
The eyes of the Lord see the righteous, and his ears hear their requests. But the face of the Lord is against those who do evil."
Who is the one who will harm you if you are eager to do what is good?
But even if you suffer because of righteousness, you are blessed. Indeed, do not be afraid of their threats, nor be troubled.
Instead, set apart the Lord Christ in your hearts as holy. Always be ready to answer everyone who asks you the reason for the confidence in God that is in you.
But do this with meekness and respect. Have a good conscience so that when they accuse you, those who insult your good life in Christ may be ashamed.
For it is better, if God desires, that you suffer for doing good than for doing evil.

For Christ also suffered once for sins. He who is righteous suffered for us, who were unrighteous, so that he would bring us to God. He was put to death in the flesh, but he was made alive by the Spirit.
By the Spirit, he went and preached to the spirits who are now in prison.

They were formerly disobedient when the patience of God was waiting in the days of Noah, in the days of the building of an ark, in which God saved a few people— that is, eight souls— by means of the water.
This is a symbol of the baptism that saves you now— not as a washing away of dirt from the body, but as the appeal of a good conscience to God— through the resurrection of Jesus Christ.
Christ is at the right hand of God. He went into heaven. Angels, authorities, and powers must submit to him.
